ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Was able to conduct oral histories to better understand the history of La Casa and campus life in the 80s.
Very interesting course that encouraged deep analysis of topic relation to transnational relations, youth studies, kinship, education, etc.
an incredible amount about the role of youth in social/economic/political reproduction.

We learned so much about childhood and young people in the United States (mostly but not entirely within Latinx communities) and Latin America. I feel like we also learned about a range of academic strategies/methodologies that are common in sociology/anthropology.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There are a lot of reading but they are all very diverse and give us a very amazing understanding of youth in the Americas
Strengths: classes were always interesting; Weaknesses: oral histories had little guidance
ramos zayas is awesome - readings were always interesting

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. Ana Ramos-Zayas is an amazing professor who challenges us to think more critical about what we read and write.

Yes of course! Similar to Latinx Ethnography, this course provides you with a background in ethnographic and archival research while expanding on youth studies particularly as they relate to the Americas.
Yes! Great class, super interesting readings, and a fantastic professor who is incredibly knowledgeable.

Yes! The readings were super well-selected and we had a nice balance of engaging lectures with thorough class conversations. I feel like the content has great breadth AND depth because we cover such a vast range of places and specific topics but we also covered such specific aspects of peoples lives, which was great.

extras.title: AMST 455 01/AMST 670 01/ANTH 470 01/EDST 405 01/ER&M 410 01/WGSS 400 01/WGSS 670 01 - Youth Cultures in the Americas
